http://www.xulplanet.com/tutorials/xultu/broadob.html http://www.xulplanet.com/reference/elemref/ref_broadcaster.html A broadcaster is used whn you want multiple elements to share one or more attribute values, or when you want elements to respond to a state change. Any elements that are observing the broadcaster will share the attributes placed on the broadcaster. For instance, if the broadcaster has a label attribute, the observes will use that label. If the label changes, the labels of the observers will update automatically. An onbroadcast event will be sent to the observers when a change is made. For menuitems or buttons that just want to have their disabled status set when the feature should be disabled, you should use a command element instead.
